clinical_study.brief_title: Tolerance of Myocardium to Ischemia Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Morning / Afternoon Variation in Myocardial Ischemia Tolerance

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to understand the impact of time-of-the day on human myocardial tolerance to ischemia-reperfusion by exploring atrial myocardium biopsied during cardiac surgery. Patients scheduled for non-urgent cardiac surgery (coronary artery by-pas graft and/or aortic valve replacement) will be assigned to a morning or an afternoon cardiac surgery based on randomization. Myocardial biopsies will be explored in ex vivo conditions mimicking ischemia-reperfusion.

primary_outcome.measure: ischemia reperfusion injury in ex vivo conditions
primary_outcome.time_frame: the day of the myocardial biopsy
primary_outcome.description: measurement of hs troponin T released by the myocardium samples in the superfusion solution after ex vivo conditions mimicking ischemia-reperfusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient scheduled for coronary artery bypass graft surgery and/or aortic valve replacement with extra-corporeal circulation
- Patient in sinus rhythm at the time of surgery
- Patient older than 18
- Patient able to understand the information and consent forms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical history of type 2 diabetes, atrial fibrillation or use of class III anti-arhythmic drug
- left ventricle ejection fraction < 40%
- Pregnancy
- Patient in emergency condition
